experiment_info.name: separable_cmaes_diagonal
experiment_info.description: Use Separable CMA-ES (diagonal-only covariance) for faster convergence
experiment_info.hypothesis: Diagonal-only covariance may be sufficient for this 2-4D problem, enabling higher learning rates.

tuning_runs.notes: Diagonal covariance WORSE on both accuracy (-0.0187) and time (5.3x over budget)

key_findings: Diagonal-only covariance HURTS both accuracy AND speed
Time: 312 min vs baseline 58.4 min (5.3x over budget)
Position correlations (x,y) ARE important for thermal source localization
CMA-ES full covariance captures heat gradient direction correlations
Removing correlations forces more iterations to converge (slower)
sep-CMA-ES is NOT suitable for this problem - cmaes_variants family FAILED for diagonal approaches
